meanings.sent1: He was cogging the system to get ahead.
meanings.sent2: She got caught cogging on the test by looking at her neighbor's paper.
meanings.sent3: The magician was cogging the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was cogging innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent5: The student tried cogging the teacher by pretending to be sick, but the teacher saw through the trick.

meanings.sent1: The cogging on the gear meshed perfectly with the other teeth.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic replaced the worn cogging on the machine to ensure smooth operation.
meanings.sent3: The missing cogging on the gear caused the whole system to malfunction.
meanings.sent4: Each cogging on the gear played a crucial role in the machinery's movement.
meanings.sent5: The shiny cogging on the gear gleamed under the bright lights of the workshop.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in dishonest practices
meanings.sent1: His cogging in business eventually led to his downfall.
meanings.sent2: The company's reputation suffered due to the cogging of its executives.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends joked about the cogging they witnessed in the movie.
meanings.sent4: The politician's cogging was exposed by investigative journalists.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of cogging can be severe, both legally and morally.
